dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¿Tienes una familia grande, Juan?
dialog.english: Do you have a big family, Juan?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: No, mi familia es pequeña. Tengo un hermano y una hermana.
dialog.english: No, my family is small. I have one brother and one sister.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Yo tengo tres hermanos.
dialog.english: How nice! I have three brothers.

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: ¿Son mayores que tú?
dialog.english: Are they older than you?

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Sí, son mayores. Y tú, ¿cómo es tu hermano?
dialog.english: Yes, they are older. And you, what is your brother like?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Mi hermano es muy trabajador y serio.
dialog.english: My brother is very hardworking and serious.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¿Cómo es tu abuela, Miguel?
dialog.english: What is your grandmother like, Miguel?

dialog.speaker: Miguel
dialog.spanish: Mi abuela es muy simpática y tranquila. También es baja.
dialog.english: My grandmother is very friendly and calm. She is also short.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Suena muy amable. ¿Y tu abuelo?
dialog.english: She sounds very kind. And your grandfather?

dialog.speaker: Miguel
dialog.spanish: Mi abuelo es alto y un poco serio, pero es muy inteligente.
dialog.english: My grandfather is tall and a little serious, but he is very intelligent.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Qué bien. Mis abuelos también son muy simpáticos.
dialog.english: How nice. My grandparents are also very friendly.

questions.question: ¿Qué adjetivo usa Miguel para su abuela?

dialog.speaker: Sara
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué hace tu padre, Mario?
dialog.english: What does your father do, Mario?

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: Mi padre es profesor en la universidad. Trabaja mucho.
dialog.english: My father is a professor at the university. He works a lot.

dialog.speaker: Sara
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué interesante! ¿Y tu madre?
dialog.english: How interesting! And your mother?

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: Mi madre es artista. Ella pinta cuadros muy bonitos.
dialog.english: My mother is an artist. She paints very beautiful paintings.

dialog.speaker: Sara
dialog.spanish: Eso es genial. Mis padres trabajan en la misma oficina.
dialog.english: That's great. My parents work in the same office.

dialog.speaker: Paula
dialog.spanish: ¿Cómo es tu mejor amiga, David?
dialog.english: What is your best friend like, David?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Mi mejor amiga se llama Ana. Es muy simpática y divertida.
dialog.english: My best friend's name is Ana. She is very friendly and funny.

dialog.speaker: Paula
dialog.spanish: Suena como una buena amiga. ¿Qué hace ella?
dialog.english: She sounds like a good friend. What does she do?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Ella es estudiante y también trabaja en un café los fines de semana.
dialog.english: She is a student and also works in a cafe on weekends.

dialog.speaker: Paula
dialog.spanish: Wow, está muy ocupada. Yo también tengo una amiga muy trabajadora.
dialog.english: Wow, she is very busy. I also have a very hardworking friend.

questions.question: ¿Cómo se llama la mejor amiga de David?
¿Qué hace Ana los fines de semana?

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Mi hermano es más alto que mi padre.
dialog.english: My brother is taller than my father.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: ¿En serio? Mi padre es más alto que mi hermano.
dialog.english: Really? My father is taller than my brother.

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Mi madre es la más inteligente de la familia.
dialog.english: My mother is the most intelligent in the family.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Mi abuela es la más divertida. Siempre cuenta chistes.
dialog.english: My grandmother is the funniest. She always tells jokes.

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Qué gracioso. Mi abuelo es el más serio.
dialog.english: How funny. My grandfather is the most serious.

questions.question: ¿Quién es más alto que el padre de Carmen?
¿Qué persona es la más inteligente en la familia de Carmen?

sentences.spanish: Hoy es el cumpleaños de mi abuelo, Carlos.
sentences.english: Today is my grandfather, Carlos', birthday.

sentences.spanish: Toda la familia está en mi casa para celebrar.
sentences.english: The whole family is at my house to celebrate.

sentences.spanish: Mi abuelo es un hombre alto y muy simpático.
sentences.english: My grandfather is a tall and very friendly man.

sentences.spanish: Mi padre, Antonio, es un cocinero excelente.
sentences.english: My father, Antonio, is an excellent cook.

sentences.spanish: Mi madre, Laura, es muy divertida y siempre ríe.
sentences.english: My mother, Laura, is very funny and always laughs.

sentences.spanish: Tengo una hermana, Sofía, que es estudiante y muy inteligente.
sentences.english: I have a sister, Sofía, who is a student and very intelligent.

sentences.spanish: Mi hermano, Mateo, es un poco serio pero también muy trabajador.
sentences.english: My brother, Mateo, is a little serious but also very hardworking.

sentences.spanish: Todos estamos muy felices de estar juntos.
sentences.english: We are all very happy to be together.

sentences.spanish: Mi abuela, Carmen, es una persona muy tranquila.
sentences.english: My grandmother, Carmen, is a very calm person.

sentences.spanish: Le gusta sentarse en el jardín y leer libros.
sentences.english: She likes to sit in the garden and read books.

sentences.spanish: Ella es baja y tiene el pelo blanco.
sentences.english: She is short and has white hair.

sentences.spanish: Cuando éramos pequeños, siempre nos contaba historias fantásticas.
sentences.english: When we were little, she always told us fantastic stories.

sentences.spanish: Mi prima, Lucía, y yo siempre escuchábamos con atención.
sentences.english: My cousin, Lucía, and I always listened carefully.

sentences.spanish: A veces, su voz se volvía misteriosa y nos asustaba un poco.
sentences.english: Sometimes, her voice would become mysterious and scare us a little.

sentences.spanish: Pero al final de cada historia, siempre reíamos.
sentences.english: But at the end of each story, we always laughed.

sentences.spanish: Mi abuela es una de las personas más especiales de mi vida.
sentences.english: My grandmother is one of the most special people in my life.

sentences.spanish: Tengo un mejor amigo que se llama Leo.
sentences.english: I have a best friend named Leo.

sentences.spanish: Leo es alto y atlético. Juega al fútbol y corre mucho.
sentences.english: Leo is tall and athletic. He plays soccer and runs a lot.

sentences.spanish: Es muy divertido y siempre me hace reír.
sentences.english: He is very funny and always makes me laugh.

sentences.spanish: A veces es un poco ocupado con el trabajo.
sentences.english: Sometimes he is a little busy with work.

sentences.spanish: Pero siempre encuentra tiempo para mí.
sentences.english: But he always finds time for me.

sentences.spanish: Hablamos de todo, de películas, de música, de la vida.
sentences.english: We talk about everything, movies, music, life.

sentences.spanish: Él es como un hermano para mí.
sentences.english: He is like a brother to me.

sentences.spanish: Es una de las personas más leales que conozco.
sentences.english: He is one of the most loyal people I know.

speaking.title: La Familia y Amigos
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas sobre la familia, amigos y descripciones personales.

question.english: How many siblings do you have?

answer.spanish: Yo tengo dos hermanos y una hermana.
answer.english: I have two brothers and one sister.

answer.spanish: Mi padre es alto y muy simpático.
answer.english: My father is tall and very friendly.

answer.spanish: Sí, mi madre es muy trabajadora.
answer.english: Yes, my mother is very hardworking.

answer.spanish: Mi abuelo es un poco serio, pero es muy inteligente.
answer.english: My grandfather is a little serious, but he is very intelligent.

answer.spanish: Él es estudiante en la universidad.
answer.english: He is a student at the university.

answer.spanish: Ella trabaja en una oficina.
answer.english: She works in an office.

answer.spanish: Sí, tengo una prima y un primo.
answer.english: Yes, I have one female cousin and one male cousin.

answer.spanish: Sí, ella es muy divertida y siempre ríe.
answer.english: Yes, she is very funny and always laughs.

answer.spanish: Mis abuelos son muy simpáticos y tranquilos.
answer.english: My grandparents are very friendly and calm.

question.english: What does your best friend do?

answer.spanish: Mi mejor amigo trabaja en un café.
answer.english: My best friend works in a cafe.

question.english: Is your grandmother tall or short?

answer.spanish: Mi abuela es baja.
answer.english: My grandmother is short.

question.spanish: ¿Quién es la persona más divertida de tu familia?
question.english: Who is the funniest person in your family?

answer.spanish: Mi abuela es la más divertida.
answer.english: My grandmother is the funniest.

question.english: Do you work with your family?

answer.spanish: Sí, mis padres y yo trabajamos en la misma oficina.
answer.english: Yes, my parents and I work in the same office.

answer.spanish: No, yo no soy muy serio.
answer.english: No, I am not very serious.

question.english: Is your male cousin a little serious?

answer.spanish: Sí, él es un poco serio a veces.
answer.english: Yes, he is a little serious sometimes.

answer.spanish: Mi madre se llama Laura.
answer.english: My mother's name is Laura.

question.spanish: ¿Tu padre es más alto que tu hermano?
question.english: Is your father taller than your brother?

answer.spanish: No, mi hermano es más alto que mi padre.
answer.english: No, my brother is taller than my father.

question.spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer con tu familia?
question.english: What do you like to do with your family?

answer.spanish: Nos gusta ir de vacaciones y comer juntos.
answer.english: We like to go on vacation and eat together.

answer.spanish: Sí, ella es muy tranquila y le gusta leer.
answer.english: Yes, she is very calm and likes to read.

question.spanish: ¿Cuál es la persona más inteligente en tu familia?
question.english: Who is the most intelligent person in your family?

answer.spanish: Mi madre es la más inteligente de la familia.
answer.english: My mother is the most intelligent in the family.
